Class DisplayManager

java.lang.Object
com.dungeonGame.logic.DisplayManager
public class DisplayManager extends Object
Handles the display of game-related information, including the current room, the player's location on the map, and their inventory.

This class includes methods to present dynamic game data to the player, providing a clear interface for interacting with the dungeon environment.

  • Method Details

    • displayCurrentRoom

      public void displayCurrentRoom(PositionDataHolder pm, PlayerDataHolder player)
      Displays information about the current room, including surroundings, the player's location, and power points.
      • Details Shown:
        • The player's current level and room coordinates.
        • Descriptions of the surroundings (e.g., walls, exits).
        • The player's current power points.
      Internal Method Calls:
      • GameUtils.clearConsole()
      • GameUtils.printHeader(String)
      • GameUtils.delayPrint(String)
      • checkCompactSurrounding(String, int, int)
      Parameters:
      pm - the player's position manager
      player - the player's data, including inventory and power points

    • displayMapWithPlayerLocation

      public void displayMapWithPlayerLocation(PositionDataHolder pm)
      Displays the current level map with the player's location marked.
      • Details Shown:
        • Walls, entrances, exits, and other rooms.
        • The player's current position marked as [P].
      Internal Method Calls:
      • GameUtils.printHeader(String)
      Parameters:
      pm - the player's position manager

    • displayInventory

      public void displayInventory(PlayerDataHolder player, PositionDataHolder pm)
      Displays the player's inventory, including usable items, and provides options to use them.
      • Details Shown:
        • All items in the player's inventory.
        • Options for using specific items, such as potions or spells.
      Internal Method Calls:
      • GameUtils.clearConsole()
      • GameUtils.printHeader(String)
      • GameUtils.delayPrint(String)
      • GameUtils.waitForEnter()
      • InventoryManager.handleInventoryItemUse(String, PlayerDataHolder, PositionDataHolder)
      Parameters:
      player - the player's data, including inventory
      pm - the player's position manager
